name: places/ChIJnzd-8lJYwokRoEmCF0KSNQc
formattedAddress: 400 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 400 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Bright budget hotel featuring streamlined rooms with free Wi-Fi, plus an eatery/bar & a terrace.

originalText.text: If I am in NYC I would definetly stay here again! I didn't have high expectations as it was such a cheap hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was small, but clean and worked for our short stay. There were a few minor issues, the biggest being that we couldn't move the bathroom door without a high pitch scraping noise so we just didn't shut the door the entire time. The light in one of the bunks was also ripped out. Besides that, it was perfect! The customer service was both great and efficient and the location made exploring the city easy

originalText.text: was a good hotel, my only issue was that they specifically told us house keeping would only clean if we signed up a day in advanced. We came back from our day out to our surprise, housekeeping had completely did our room without our knowledge or us wanting it. We didn’t have the opportunity to lock anything in the safe or put away our personas affects. After asking the front desk why it was done they said house keeping chooses rooms to clean randomly, but didn’t inform us at check-in of that detail.

text.text: was a good hotel, my only issue was that they specifically told us house keeping would only clean if we signed up a day in advanced. We came back from our day out to our surprise, housekeeping had completely did our room without our knowledge or us wanting it. We didn’t have the opportunity to lock anything in the safe or put away our personas affects. After asking the front desk why it was done they said house keeping chooses rooms to clean randomly, but didn’t inform us at check-in of that detail.

originalText.text:
When we arrived the bed sheets were dirty. They sent directly new ones to the room, but we had to put them on by ourselves. At least they said sorry. If you want your room cleaned you need to put your name and room on a list the dat before. Once we did that, our room was not cleaned. When I went to the reception they just offered to send new towels. Not even a sorry. When I asked to be put on the list for the next day, they said it was already too late. Great service..
You have to pay fees for everything in this hotel but the service sucks..
The rooms are really small, but it is enough to just sleep there.
The only good thing is the location.

originalText.text: Pod Times Square saved our trip. We were in a bad hotel and were able to get a same-day reservation for a bunk room for about the same price as the budget hotel we originally booked in Jersey. It was tiny but perfect for what we needed and at the right price. You can't beat the location, either. It's a short walk to Times Square, but far enough away that it's a bit quieter. Starbucks around the corner, a nice bar and lounge area. The only thing that would have been better is if the bar had served even light snacks. There was no food service at all. Overall, we were so grateful to have been able to stay at the Pod.

originalText.text: Amazing experience! Super clean, comfortable, and quiet! Can’t recommend enough especially considering the location. The view of the empire state building from our room was just breathtaking. I will be back again soon!
